010package imagingbook.pub.color.filters;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014
015import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter2D;
016import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
017import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
018import imagingbook.lib.math.VectorNorm;
019import imagingbook.lib.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
020
021/**
022 * Sharpening vector median filter for color images implemented
023 * by extending the {@link GenericFilter2D} class.
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2013/05/30
026 */
027public class VectorMedianFilterSharpen extends GenericFilter2D {
028        
029        public static class Parameters {
030                /** Filter radius */
031                public double radius = 3.0;
032                /** Sharpening factor (0 = none, 1 = max.) */
033                public double sharpen = 0.5;
034                /** Threshold for replacing the current center pixel */
035                public double threshold = 0.0;  
036                /** Distance norm to use */
037                public NormType distanceNorm = NormType.L1;
038                /** For testing only */
039                public boolean showMask = false;
040                /** For testing only */
041                public boolean markModifiedPixels = false;
042                /** For testing only */
043                public Color modifiedColor = Color.black;
044        }
045        
046        private final FilterMask mask;
047        private final int[][] supportRegion;            // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
048        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
049        private final int a;                                            // a = 2,...,n
050        private final Parameters params;
051        
052        private int[] modColor;
053        
054        /** For testing only */
055        public int modifiedCount = 0;
056        
057        /**
058         * Uses default parameters.
059         */
060        public VectorMedianFilterSharpen() {    
061                this(new Parameters());
062        }
063        
064        public VectorMedianFilterSharpen(Parameters params) {
065                this.params = params;
066                mask = new FilterMask(params.radius);
067                int maskCount = mask.getCount();
068                supportRegion = new int[maskCount][3];
069                a = (int) Math.round(maskCount - params.sharpen * (maskCount - 2));
070                vNorm = params.distanceNorm.create();
071                initialize();
072        }
073        
074        private void initialize() {
075                modColor = new int[] {params.modifiedColor.getRed(), params.modifiedColor.getGreen(), params.modifiedColor.getBlue()};
076                if (params.showMask) 
077                        mask.show("Mask");
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        protected float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor source, int u, int v) {
082                throw new UnsupportedOperationException("no filter for gray images");
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Vector median filter for RGB color images
087         */
088        @Override
089        protected float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
090                final int[] pCtr = new int[3];          // center pixel
091                final float[] pCtrf = ia.getPix(u, v);
092                copyRgbTo(pCtrf, pCtr);                 // TODO: check, not elegant
093                getSupportRegion(ia, u, v);
094                double dCtr = trimmedAggregateDistance(pCtr, supportRegion, a); 
095                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
096                int jMin = -1;
097                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
098                        int[] p = supportRegion[j];
099                        double d = trimmedAggregateDistance(p, supportRegion, a);
100                        if (d < dMin) {
101                                jMin = j;
102                                dMin = d;
103                        }
104                }
105                int[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
106                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
107                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
108                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
109                final float[] pF = new float[3];                        // the returned color tupel
110                if (dCtr - dMin > params.threshold * a) {       // modify this pixel
111                        if (params.markModifiedPixels) {
112                                copyRgbTo(modColor, pF);
113                                modifiedCount++;
114                        }
115                        else {
116                                copyRgbTo(pmin, pF);
117                        }
118                }
119                else {  // keep the original pixel value
120                        copyRgbTo(pCtr, pF);
121                }
122                return pF;
123        }
124        
125        private int[][] getSupportRegion(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
126                //final int[] p = new int[3];
127                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
128                int n = 0;
129                final int[][] maskArray = mask.getMask();
130                final int maskCenter = mask.getCenter();
131                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
132                        int ui = u + i - maskCenter;
133                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
134                                if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
135                                        int vj = v + j - maskCenter;
136                                        final float[] p = ia.getPix(ui, vj);
137                                        copyRgbTo(p, supportRegion[n]);
138                                        n = n + 1;
139                                }
140                        }
141                }
142                return supportRegion;
143        }
144        
145//      private void copyRgbTo(int[] source, int[] target) {
146//              target[0] = source[0];
147//              target[1] = source[1];
148//              target[2] = source[2];
149//      }
150        
151        private void copyRgbTo(float[] source, int[] target) {
152                target[0] = (int) source[0];
153                target[1] = (int) source[1];
154                target[2] = (int) source[2];
155        }
156        
157        private void copyRgbTo(int[] source, float[] target) {
158                target[0] = source[0];
159                target[1] = source[1];
160                target[2] = source[2];
161        }
162        
163        // find the color with the smallest summed distance to all others.
164        // brute force and thus slow
165//      private double aggregateDistance(int[] p, int[][] P) {
166//              double d = 0;
167//              for (int i = 0; i < P.length; i++) {
168//                      d = d + vNorm.distance(p, P[i]);
169//              }
170//              return d;
171//      }
172        
173        private double trimmedAggregateDistance(int[] p, int[][] P, int a) {
174                if (a <= 1) {
175                        return 0;       // aggregate distance of rank 1 is always zero
176                }
177                int N = P.length;
178                final double[] R = new double[N];
179                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
180                        R[i] = vNorm.distance(p, P[i]);
181                }
182                if (a < N) {
183                        Arrays.sort(R); // only sort if the rank is less than N
184                }
185                double d = 0;
186                for (int i = 1; i < a; i++) {
187                        d = d + R[i];
188                }
189                return d;
190        }
191        
192//      private final int rgbToInt (int r, int g, int b) {
193//              return ((r & 0xFF)<<16) | ((g & 0xFF)<<8) | b & 0xFF;
194//      }
195
196}
